oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Impact of Two Coliform Mastitis Immunization Schedules on Immune Response, Milk Yield, Intramammary Infection and Dry Matter Feed Intake in Holstein Dairy Cattle
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Petersson, Christina S.
Leslie, Ken E.
Kelton, David F.
Mallard, Bonnie A.
Osborne, Tera M.
Fairfield, Angela M.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: coliform mastitis
vaccination protocols
dry matter intake
milk bacteriological status
immune response
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Although coliform mastitis immunization programs are widely implemented, several questions concerning the proper administration schedule remain unanswered. Thus, a comparison of two vaccination protocols was conducted to determine the effects on immune response, milk production, milk bacteriological status and dry matter intake (DMI).
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2003; 165-166
